Hi,

I was trying to run Heritrix-2.0.0 in windows yesterday and ran into a=

slightly different problem. I followed the instructions for the
jmxremote.=
password file. That seemed to work fine, but then I ran into
the following =
error message:

unless -n is specified, you must specify an admin password =
for the web
UI using -a

Did I miss something? Where would I set this? Any =
suggestions would be
greatly appreciated.

Thanks!

--- In archive-crawler@=
yahoogroups.com, Pratyushbanerjee@... wrote:
>
> Hi,
>  
> I had tried runn=
ing Heritrix-2.0.0 in windows a few days back and
had faced  
> the same pr=
oblem.
> Since Heritrix-2.0.0 comes with integrated JMX control, hence the
=
system  
> requires the jmx password by default. 
>  
> This however is not=
 the case in Linux wherein one can run
Heritrix-2.0.0  
> without configuri=
ng the JMX  password. 
>  
> In case you still want to run the Heritrix-2.0=
.0 from windows,
create a  file 
> called jmxremote.password and type in th=
e JMX user name and password  
> therein. Place the file in the HERITRIX_HO=
ME directory. The template
of the  file can 
> be seen in  <JAVA_HOME>\jre\=
lib\management\jmxremote.password.template
>  
> Also not every heritrix2.0=
.0 build available from the website seemed
to  
> work. I am currently usin=
g
heritrix-2.0.0-20080220.023905-129-dist.zip which  does 
> work for windo=
ws (XP).
>  
> Do let me know if this solves your problem or not.
>  
> reg=
ards
>  
> Pratyush Banerjee
> S/W Engineer
> AOL India Pvt. Ltd.
> India
